issues.title: Elements must only use permitted ARIA attributes
issues.description: Ensure ARIA attributes are not prohibited for an element's role

none.message: aria-label attribute cannot be used on a div with no valid role attribute.

nodes.failureSummary:
Fix all of the following:
  aria-label attribute cannot be used on a div with no valid role attribute.

issues.title: Elements use prohibited ARIA attributes
issues.description: Using ARIA attributes in roles where they are prohibited can mean that important information is not communicated to users of assistive technologies. [Learn more about prohibited ARIA roles](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/aria-prohibited-attr).

node.explanation:
Fix all of the following:
  aria-label attribute cannot be used on a div with no valid role attribute.

issues.title: Elements must meet minimum color contrast ratio thresholds
issues.description: Ensure the contrast between foreground and background colors meets WCAG 2 AA minimum contrast ratio thresholds

any.message: Element has insufficient color contrast of 2.73 (foreground color: #ffffff, background color: #00acc1, font size: 12.0pt (16px), font weight: normal). Expected contrast ratio of 4.5:1

nodes.failureSummary:
Fix any of the following:
  Element has insufficient color contrast of 2.73 (foreground color: #ffffff, background color: #00acc1, font size: 12.0pt (16px), font weight: normal). Expected contrast ratio of 4.5:1

issues.title: Elements must meet minimum color contrast ratio thresholds

any.message: Element has insufficient color contrast of 2.73 (foreground color: #ffffff, background color: #00acc1, font size: 12.0pt (16px), font weight: normal). Expected contrast ratio of 4.5:1

issues.title: This element has insufficient contrast at this conformance level. Expected a contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1, but text in this element has a contrast ratio of 2.74:1. Recommendation:  change background to #008292.

original_issue.message: This element has insufficient contrast at this conformance level. Expected a contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1, but text in this element has a contrast ratio of 2.74:1. Recommendation:  change background to #008292.
original_issue.selector: html > body > div > main > div:nth-child(1) > a:nth-child(2)

issues.title: This element has insufficient contrast at this conformance level. Expected a contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1, but text in this element has a contrast ratio of 2.74:1. Recommendation:  change background to #008292.

original_issue.message: This element has insufficient contrast at this conformance level. Expected a contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1, but text in this element has a contrast ratio of 2.74:1. Recommendation:  change background to #008292.
original_issue.selector: html > body > div > main > div:nth-child(1) > a:nth-child(5)

issues.title: Background and foreground colors do not have a sufficient contrast ratio.
issues.description: Low-contrast text is difficult or impossible for many users to read. [Learn how to provide sufficient color contrast](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/color-contrast).

automatic.name: Headings; Wrong Order, Empty & Missing Headings;

issues.title: Page should contain a level-one heading
issues.description: Ensure that the page, or at least one of its frames contains a level-one heading

all.message: Page must have a level-one heading

nodes.failureSummary:
Fix all of the following:
  Page must have a level-one heading

issues.title: This textinput element does not have a name available to an accessibility API. Valid names are: label element, title undefined, aria-label undefined, aria-labelledby undefined.

original_issue.message: This textinput element does not have a name available to an accessibility API. Valid names are: label element, title undefined, aria-label undefined, aria-labelledby undefined.
original_issue.selector: html > body > div > header > div:nth-child(3) > div > input

issues.title: This form field should be labelled in some way. Use the label element (either with a "for" attribute or wrapped around the form field), or "title", "aria-label" or "aria-labelledby" attributes as appropriate.

original_issue.message: This form field should be labelled in some way. Use the label element (either with a "for" attribute or wrapped around the form field), or "title", "aria-label" or "aria-labelledby" attributes as appropriate.
original_issue.selector: html > body > div > header > div:nth-child(3) > div > input
